This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=COW.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-10T09:51:32Z Crest-Admin 2015-02-10T09:47:34+00:00 2015-02-10T09:47:34+00:00 COW 40 - SSBSE 2015 Challenge: Collaborative Jam Session - 30 + 31 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;2b162130.1502 Dear All<br><br>Please find information below regarding our upcoming CREST open Workshop in March 2015.<br><br>The 40th CREST Open Workshop<http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/index.php?id=7430> - SSBSE 2015 Challenge: Collaborative Jam Session<br><br>Date: 30 + 31 March 2015<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL (Directions<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/efd/roombooking/building-location/?id=045>, or 'C5' on the map here<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/cdb/map>, or Find it on Google maps<http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=117653667497739233023.00049382c0ecd498ed715&ll=51.522838,-0.132037&spn=0.001155,0.002677&z=19>.)<br>Overview:<br>The 7th Symposium on Search Based Software Engineering (http://ssbse.org/2015/) is hosting a Challenge Track, in which authors are invited to submit six-page papers describing the application of SBSE techniques to one of three real-world example programs, listed in the challenge call. The purpose of this [...] Crest-Admin 2015-01-13T11:47:03+00:00 2015-01-13T11:47:03+00:00 COW 38 + 39: COW 38: Working Tutorial on Statistical Methods in Experimental Software Engineering - 26/27 Jan 2015 and COW 39: Measuring, Testing and Optimising Computational Energy Consumption - 23/24 Feb 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;bd4e5c49.1501 Dear All<br><br>Happy new year!<br><br>Here is a reminder about our upcoming CREST open Workshops in January and February.<br><br>The 38th CREST Open Workshop<http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/index.php?id=7206>: Working Tutorial on Statistical Methods in Experimental Software Engineering<br><br>Date: 26 - 27 January 2015<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL (Directions<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/efd/roombooking/building-location/?id=045>, or 'C5' on the map here<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/cdb/map>, or Find it on Google maps<http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=117653667497739233023.00049382c0ecd498ed715&ll=51.522838,-0.132037&spn=0.001155,0.002677&z=19>.) 26/27 January 2015 and COW 39: Measuring, Testing and Optimising Computational Energy Consumption - 23/24 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;634e1ec1.1412 The 38th CREST Open Workshop: Working Tutorial on Statistical Methods in Experimental Software Engineering<br><br>Date: 26 - 27 January 2015<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL (Directions<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/efd/roombooking/building-location/?id=045>, or 'C5' on the map here<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/cdb/map>, or Find it on Google maps<http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=117653667497739233023.00049382c0ecd498ed715&ll=51.522838,-0.132037&spn=0.001155,0.002677&z=19>.)<br><br>Speaker: Dr Simon Poulding<http://simonpoulding.net/><br><br>Dr. Poulding is a postdoctoral researcher at the Blekinge Institute of Technology in Sweden. He has widely published on software engineering in general and search based software engineering in particular and his work is marked out for its exemplary use of inferential statistical techniques for data analysis. His work has appeared in the leading journals [...] Crest-Admin 2014-12-09T15:36:23+00:00 2014-12-09T15:36:23+00:00 **Visa Europe and UCL PhD in Search Based Optimisation of Software Testing** https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;21cfa0e3.1412 Visa Europe and UCL are offering a PhD in Search Based Optimisation of Software Testing<br>University College London is offering a fully funded student bursary in Search Based Optimisation of Software Testing to start as soon as possible. The student will undertake a UCL PhD, the focus of which will be having a direct impact on improving Visa software systems. It will be a chance for the student to work collaboratively in both academic and industrial sites, developing innovative techniques and evaluating them on real-world systems at Visa.<br>This impact studentship will recruit a talented and dedicated PhD student to [...] Crest-Admin 2014-10-23T15:59:16+00:00 2014-10-23T15:59:16+00:00 37th CREST Open Workshop - Working Tutorial on Empirical Software Engineering Methods - 24-25 Nov 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;d6c0bca8.1410 The 37th CREST Open Workshop<br><br>Working Tutorial on Empirical Software Engineering Methods<br><br>Date: 24 - 25 November 2014<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL<br><br>Registration:<br><br>Please note that there will be an attendance fee of \ufffd\ufffd200 for this tutorial.<br><br>Please check the website for more details and registration here: http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/37<br><br>Speaker:<br><br>Per Runeson, Department of Computer Science, Lund University, Sweden [...] Crest-Admin 2014-09-03T11:32:01+00:00 2014-09-03T11:32:01+00:00 36th CREST Open Workshop - App Store Analysis - 27-28 Oct 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;f012d1e9.1409 The 36th CREST Open Workshop<br><br>App Store Analysis<br>http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/36/<br><br>Date: 27 - 28 October 2014<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL (Directions<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/efd/roombooking/building-location/?id=045>, or 'C5' on the map here<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/cdb/map>, or Find it on Google maps<http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=117653667497739233023.00049382c0ecd498ed715&ll=51.522838,-0.132037&spn=0.001155,0.002677&z=19>.)<br><br>Registration Deadline:<br>20th October 2014<br>*Free registration at: http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/reg/<br><br>Overview:<br>App stores provide a rich source of information for software engineering research: It is, of course, possible to extract technical information as with other software systems. However, we can also readily obtain information relating to customer reviews, pricing and popularity. Never before in history of software engineering has so much information been available concerning [...] Crest-Admin 2014-08-27T16:02:17+00:00 2014-08-27T16:02:17+00:00 35th CREST Open Workshop - Tutorial on writing EPSRC ICT proposals - 15-16 Sep 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;6549de82.1408 The 35th CREST Open Workshop<br>Tutorial on writing EPSRC ICT proposals<br><br>Date:<br><br>15 - 16 September 2014<br><br>Venue:<br><br>Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL (Directions<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/efd/roombooking/building-location/?id=045>, or 'C5' on the map here<http://www.ucl.ac.uk/cdb/map>, or Find it on Google maps<http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=117653667497739233023.00049382c0ecd498ed715&ll=51.522838,-0.132037&spn=0.001155,0.002677&z=19>.)<br><br>Registration Deadline:<br>9th September 2014<br>Free registration at: http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/reg/<br><br>Speaker:<br><br>Professor John Clark<http://www-users.cs.york.ac.uk/%7Ejac/>, Department of Computer Science and YYCSA, University of York, UK [...] Crest-Admin 2014-05-08T16:07:37+00:00 2014-05-08T16:07:37+00:00 34th CREST Open Workshop - CREST Annual Review - 19-20 May 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COW;9978187b.1405 The 34th CREST Open Workshop<br>CREST Annual Review<br>http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/34/<br><br>Date: 19 - 20 May 2014<br><br>Venue: Engineering Front Executive Suite, Roberts Building, UCL<br><br>Registration Deadline:<br>13th May 2014<br>*Free registration at: http://crest.cs.ucl.ac.uk/cow/reg/<br><br>Overview:<br><br>This workshop will present a review of recent research undertaken in CREST. Each post-doctoral researcher and PhD student in CREST will present a short (20 minute) talk, highlighting recent research results. There will be plenty of time for discussion, as with all of our COWs.
